title: Antonio Conte tells Michy Batshuayi: You’ll only play when you prove to me you’re good enough
text:
EFL buck your ideas up Antonio Conte tells Michy Batshuayi: You’ll only play when you prove to me you’re good enough 
Chelsea boss makes it clear unsettled striker has to do more to warrant a place as summer departure inches closer By Duncan Wright, Senior Sports Writer 3rd March 2017, 2:58 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ANTONIO CONTE has warned Michy Batshuayi to forget about forcing his way into the Chelsea side until he proves he deserves a chance. 
Batshuayi’s move to Stamford Bridge has been a major let-down as the £33million striker struggles to make any kind of impression in England. PA:Press Association 2 Michy Batshuayi has been warned he must do more to prove he is good enough to start at Chelsea 
The Belgian international has now been linked with a summer move away from the Blues after failing to convince Conte he is good enough to play. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And the Chelsea boss refused to commit to Batshuayi still being at Stamford Bridge next season at his press conference ahead of Monday’s trip to West Ham. Reuters 2 Chelsea boss Antonio Conte is demanding more from his struggling striker 
Asked if Batshuayi had a Chelsea future, Conte said: “When you ask about my players the most important thing is the present, and at the end of the season we see the situation of every single player. 
“Now he is working very well with us, he must continue to work. 
“If he shows me he deserves to play I will put him in the starting eleven, if he doesn’t then we will continue in this way.” 
Conte’s words were a clear message to the 22-year-old to stop moping around and start trying to prove he belongs at a club like Chelsea. 
He has made 23 appearances for the club this season, mostly as substitute, and has netted just five times in all competitions. 
But he is yet to start a single Premier League game, and his only goal in the competition came in the second match of the season. Monday Premier League match preview as West Ham prepare to take on Chelsea
